instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01700 no power all ports cycle
threads.message: working on 820-01700  2.4,64,8tb,5600m great specs, and great condition, board is clean, no liquid damage, all ports amp meter just cycle on off wont even display voltage, just lights up and goes back off, looks like 5v .3 amp on all ports all cycling after 1 sec

threads.title: 820-01700 no power all ports cycle
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on CC1/2 pins of all ports.
Also check the same at R7020 and F7000/1.

threads.title: 820-01700 no power all ports cycle
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on CC1/2 pins of all ports mot sure what u mean by CC1/2 pins
 R7020 
 F7000/1. diode mode .393

threads.title: 820-01700 no power all ports cycle
threads.message:
Don't you find "CC1" and "CC2" on schematic???
Shouldn't be dificult to find them around CD3217 chips.

Read more threads on the forum, not just yours.
Unless you are not interested to gather free useful information.
